brief_summary.textblock:
Hepatocellular carcinoma represents 80-90% of primary hepatic malignant tumors. 80% of
      patients with hepatocellular carcinoma are associated with cirrhosis.

      Chemoembolization is a process in which a chemotherapeutic agent is deposited directly into
      the hepatic tumor where the principal artery is embolized.

      Bioelectrical impedance bases its evaluation in a model where the body is conformed by two
      different compartments: fat mass and fat free mass.

      Bioelectrical impedance is complemented by vectorial analysis, which is independent to the
      state of hydration and is helpful to monitor any changes in corporal composition. It can be
      used as a control for the interpretation of the bioelectrical impedance.

clinical_study.brief_title: Body Composition Analysis in Patients Undergoing Chemoembolization

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients with hepato-renal disease

          -  Patients with hepatocellular carcinoma that are put down to radiofrequency
             ablation

          -  Patients with depression or any psiquiatric disease.

          -  Patients that don't agree to participate in the project.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients with hepatocellular carcinoma that are put down to radiofrequency
             ablation

          -  Patients with depression or any psiquiatric disease.

          -  Patients that don't agree to participate in the project.

study_pop.textblock: The patients will be recruited from the Radiology Department of a tertiary care center.

facility.name: Instituto Nacional de Ciencias Médicas y Nutrición "Salvador Zubirán"

clinical_study.official_title: Body Composition Analysis by Bioelectrical Impedance Vector Analysis in Patients With Hepatocellular Carcinoma Undergoing Chemoembolization.

overall_official.affiliation: Instituto Nacional de Nutrición y Ciencias Médicas "Salvador Zubirán"

primary_outcome.description: To evaluate any changes in corporal composition in patients undergoing chemoembolization.
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 hour before treatment, 2 weeks after treatment, and 1 month after treatment

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
